intro: Clinopodium loesenerianum, commonly known as narrowleaf mountain mint, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom in late summer. Clinopodium loesenerianum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
